node.title: NSW changes travel advice for southern Africa in response to new COVID variant
node.alt: a woman picking up luggage at an airport
node.description: Travellers arriving in NSW from southern Africa are now required to get tested for COVID-19 and isolate as health officials move to stop the spread of the new Omicron variant.
node.content:
["Travellers from southern Africa entering New South Wales are urged to isolate and get tested for COVID-19.", "This includes anyone who had been in South Africa, Lesotho, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Namibia, and Eswatini, in the 14 days before arriving in NSW.", "All people in the household are also being told to isolate until further notice.", "NSW Health announced the change today in response to concerns over the new COVID-19\u00a0variant, Omicron B.1.1.529, which was first identified in South Africa.", "Cases have now also been found in Botswana, Hong Kong, Belgium and Israel.", "\"The emergence of this new variant reinforces the critical importance of all fully vaccinated travellers who return from overseas complying with the NSW Health guidelines,\" NSW Health said in a statement.", "\"There are requirements to be tested and restrictions on attending certain high-risk premises.\"", "No cases of Omicron have been identified in NSW, the health department has confirmed.", "", "
\u00a0Mr Hazzard says Omicron could be more transmissible than Delta.(ABC News)
", "The federal government is also expected to announce quarantine changes for these returned travellers later today.", "It will join more than 20 nations in implementing measures to stop the spread of Omicron.", "Current rules in NSW for other international visitors require they get a COVID-19 PCR test within 24 hours of arriving and another test at day six. Self-isolation is not necessary while they wait for their result.", "NSW Health said they were working closely with the Commonwealth and other states and territories to gather information on the new variant.", "Health Minister Brad Hazzard said the new\u00a0COVID variant was very concerning.", "\"The fact that it has now taken over in terms of growth beyond Delta indicates that it's likely, but we are not sure yet, that it is more transmissible than Delta,\" Mr Hazzard said.", "\"Now, that's concerning for anyone in public health across the world.\"", "Returned travellers from southern Africa are also urged to get in touch with the health department.", "Dozens of countries including the United States and the United Kingdom have already closed their borders to South Africa and its neighbouring countries.", "Scientists said it could take weeks to fully understand the variant's mutations and whether existing vaccines and treatments would work against it.", "US infectious disease expert Dr Anthony Fauci said they were rushing to make contact with their counterparts in South Africa\u00a0to learn more about it.", "\"Right now we're getting the material together with our South African colleagues to get a situation where you could actually directly test it,\" Dr Fauci said.", "\"So right now you're talking about a red flag that this might be an issue, but we don't know.\"", "In the 24 hours to 8pm last night, there were 235 new locally acquired COVID-19 cases in NSW and no deaths.", "There are 174 people in hospital, 26 are in intensive care and 10 require ventilation.", "Up until Friday, 92.4 per cent of those aged 16 and over were fully vaccinated and 94.5\u00a0per cent had received at least one COVID jab.", "", "
What COVID-19 travel insurance doesn't cover you for(Emilia Terzon)
"]
